intro: Verbascum basivelatum, commonly known as the low velvetleaf. It is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia, characterized by its fuzzy, gray-green leaves and tall, showy yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It thrives in full sun and is drought-tolerant, making it suitable for xeriscaping. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
